message: You ever notice how quiet it is out here? No birds, no wind—just silence heavy enough to choke on.
A cursed silence. The land remembers every drop of blood spilled over gold and water. Greed made the sand itself hungry.
Greed? That's what birthed this Hellrift?
Aye. Men built shrines of wealth in a place that had none. When they finally turned on each other, Hell heard the prayers meant for treasure.
So the desert didn't just die—it was [jitter]consumed[/jitter].
And it's still feeding. The Rift's heart lies beneath the dunes somewhere. We'll know we're close when the sand starts to glimmer.
Exactly. That's Hell's joke—temptation lighting your path to damnation.
Spoke too soon. Looks like the desert still has claimants.
